name: Calcium fluoride
desc: Calcium fluoride is the inorganic compound with the formula CaF2. It is a white insoluble solid. It occurs as the mineral fluorite (also called fluorspar), which is often deeply coloured owing to impurities.
Appearance: White crystalline solid (single crystals are transparent)
Solubility:
insoluble in acetone
slightly soluble in acid
Main hazards: Reacts with conc. sulfuric acid to produce hydrofluoric acid
Other anions:
Calcium chloride
Calcium bromide
Calcium iodide
Other cations:
Beryllium fluoride
Magnesium fluoride
Strontium fluoride
Barium fluoride
standard state:
